thread.title: Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant
thread.title_full: Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant

title: Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant
text:
Facebook Email Twitter Google+ LinkedIn Pinterest Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant Two western Colorado regions with close ties to the coal mining industry will work to diversify their economies with the help from a federal program. Post to Facebook Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant Two western Colorado regions with close ties to the coal mining industry will work to diversify their economies with the help from a federal program.  //on9news.tv/1RMBn3x   Join the Conversation To   Western Slope mining communities to get federal grant Associated Press, news source 9:58 a.m. MDT October 16, 2015 Region 10 League of Economics Assistance and Planning (Photo: Region 10 League of Economics Assistance and Planning) CONNECT TWEET LINKEDIN COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
GRAND JUNCTION, Colo. (AP) - Two western Colorado regions with close ties to the coal mining industry will work to diversify their economies with the help from a federal program. 
The Daily Sentinel in Grand Junction reports that on Thursday the Montrose-based Region 10 League of Economics Assistance and Planning received a $1.2 million grant to support its broadband infrastructure efforts. Moffat County also received $50,000 for the study of current commercial and economic needs and assets of the county and surrounding region. 
The Colorado grants were among 36 issued to the first round of recipients of the Obama administration's Partnership for Opportunity and Workforce and Economic Revitalization grants. In total, communities received $15 million. 
The POWER grant program is intended to help mining areas adjust as the country uses less coal.
